children.description: Biotechnology for manufacturing involves working with nature to maximize and optimize existing biochemical pathways that can be used in manufacturing. The industrial biotechnology revolution rides on a series of related developments in three fields of study of detailed information derived from the cell: genomics, proteomics, and bioinformatics. As a result, scientists can apply new techniques to a large number of microorganisms ranging from bacteria, yeasts, and fungi to marine diatoms and protozoa.
children.label: biotechnology for manufacturing
children.long_description: Biotechnology for manufacturing involves working with nature to maximize and optimize existing biochemical pathways that can be used in manufacturing. The industrial biotechnology revolution rides on a series of related developments in three fields of study of detailed information derived from the cell: genomics, proteomics, and bioinformatics. As a result, scientists can apply new techniques to a large number of microorganisms ranging from bacteria, yeasts, and fungi to marine diatoms and protozoa.

children.description: Micro- and nanotechnologies in manufacturing involves the generic technology development focused on exploratory research for the continued shrinking of horizontal and vertical physical feature sizes, for use in manufacturing.
children.label: mne in manufacturing
children.long_description: Micro- and nanotechnologies in manufacturing involves the generic technology development focused on exploratory research for the continued shrinking of horizontal and vertical physical feature sizes, for use in manufacturing. Mne in manufacturing.

children.description: Nanotechnologies in manufacturing involves the use of nanotechnology to make products with improved capabilities or to reduce their manufacturing cost.
children.label: nanotechnologies for manufacturing
children.long_description: Nanotechnologies in manufacturing involves the use of nanotechnology to make products with improved capabilities or to reduce their manufacturing cost. Nanotechnologies for manufacturing.

children.description: Photonics for manufacturing involves the use of optics and photonics specifically in the manufacturing industry, for instance the use of new lasers for car manufacturing.
children.label: photonics for manufacturing
children.long_description: Photonics for manufacturing involves the use of optics and photonics specifically in the manufacturing industry, for instance the use of new lasers for car manufacturing.

children.description: Software for manufacturing provides real-time access to plant activities that include equipment, labor, orders and inventory. Manufacturing Execution Software (MES) integrates the data with enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems so that management has complete control of the operation from the factory floor to the supply chain.
children.label: software for manufacturing
children.long_description: Software for manufacturing provides real-time access to plant activities that include equipment, labor, orders and inventory. Manufacturing Execution Software (MES) integrates the data with enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems so that management has complete control of the operation from the factory floor to the supply chain.

children.description: Advanced Manufacturing Technology encompass the use of innovative technology to improve products or processes that drive innovation. It covers two types of technologies: process technology that is used to produce any of the other five KETs, and process technology that is based on robotics, automation technology or computer-integrated manufacturing. For the former, such process technology typically relates to production apparatus, equipment and procedures for the manufacture of specific materials and components. For the latter, process technology includes measuring, control and testing devices for machines, machine tools and various areas of automated or IT-based manufacturing technology.
children.label: Advanced manufacturing technology
children.long_description: Advanced Manufacturing Technology encompass the use of innovative technology to improve products or processes that drive innovation. It covers two types of technologies: process technology that is used to produce any of the other five KETs, and process technology that is based on robotics, automation technology or computer-integrated manufacturing. For the former, such process technology typically relates to production apparatus, equipment and procedures for the manufacture of specific materials and components. For the latter, process technology includes measuring, control and testing devices for machines, machine tools and various areas of automated or IT-based manufacturing technology.

children.description: While traditional biomaterials such as leather, cotton and wood have been used worldwide for millennia, technological developments in materials chemistry and engineering now make it possible to manufacture advanced biomaterials with competitive price and mechanical performance to other “conventional” advanced materials, applicable in a wide range of industries. Some of the sub-categories of advanced biomaterials include: fibres; binders and matrices; and biocomposites.
children.label: advanced biomaterials
children.long_description: While traditional biomaterials such as leather, cotton and wood have been used worldwide for millennia, technological developments in materials chemistry and engineering now make it possible to manufacture advanced biomaterials with competitive price and mechanical performance to other “conventional” advanced materials, applicable in a wide range of industries. Some of the sub-categories of advanced biomaterials include: fibres; binders and matrices; and biocomposites.

children.description: Advanced ceramic is an inorganic, nonmetallic (ceramic), basically crystalline material of rigorously controlled composition and manufactured with detailed regulation from highly refined and/or characterized raw materials giving precisely specified attributes. Advanced ceramics are referred to in various parts of the world as technical ceramics, high-tech ceramics, and high-performance ceramics.
children.label: advanced ceramics
children.long_description: Advanced ceramic is an inorganic, nonmetallic (ceramic), basically crystalline material of rigorously controlled composition and manufactured with detailed regulation from highly refined and/or characterized raw materials giving precisely specified attributes. Advanced ceramics are referred to in various parts of the world as technical ceramics, high-tech ceramics, and high-performance ceramics.

children.description: Advanced metals involves the development and use of new  metals  with  predetermined  mechanical,  physical  and  functional properties  as  e.g.  amorphous  materials,  ultra-fine-grained  (including  nanostructured)  etc.
children.label: advanced metals
children.long_description: Advanced metals involves the development and use of new  metals  with  predetermined  mechanical,  physical  and  functional properties  as  e.g.  amorphous  materials,  ultra-fine-grained  (including  nanostructured)  etc.

children.description: Advanced polymer composites are heterogeneous materials resulting from the combination of different constituents, including high-performance fibres, a polymer matrix and various fillers and additives. These include synthetic engineering-nonconducting polymers, engineered plastics, conducting polymers or organic-electronic materials OPEs, advanced coatings, advanced/nanofibers, etc.
children.label: advanced polymers
children.long_description: Advanced polymer composites are heterogeneous materials resulting from the combination of different constituents, including high-performance fibres, a polymer matrix and various fillers and additives. These include synthetic engineering-nonconducting polymers, engineered plastics, conducting polymers or organic-electronic materials OPEs, advanced coatings, advanced/nanofibers, etc. Advanced polymers.

children.description: Superconductivity is the set of physical properties observed in certain materials, wherein electrical resistance vanishes and from which magnetic flux fields are expelled. Adavanced superconductors involve materials exhibiting these properties.
children.label: advanced superconductors
children.long_description: Superconductivity is the set of physical properties observed in certain materials, wherein electrical resistance vanishes and from which magnetic flux fields are expelled. Adavanced superconductors involve materials exhibiting these properties. Advanced superconductors.

children.description: Composites can be made from an incredibly diverse range of materials – including wood and other plants in the form of fibers, particles, strands, veneer, and lumber. Novel composite materials research reflects this spectrum, and addresses the design, manufacturing, adhesion, modeling, and performance of new composites.
children.label: novel composites
children.long_description: Composites can be made from an incredibly diverse range of materials – including wood and other plants in the form of fibers, particles, strands, veneer, and lumber. Novel composite materials research reflects this spectrum, and addresses the design, manufacturing, adhesion, modeling, and performance of new composites. Novel composites.

children.description: Advanced Materials lead both to new reduced cost substitutes to existing materials and to new higher added-value products and services. Advanced Materials offer major improvements in a wide variety of different fields, e.g. in aerospace, transport, building and health care. They facilitate recycling, lowering the carbon footprint and energy demand as well as limiting the need for raw materials that are scarce in Europe.
children.label: Advanced materials
children.long_description: Advanced Materials lead both to new reduced cost substitutes to existing materials and to new higher added-value products and services. Advanced Materials offer major improvements in a wide variety of different fields, e.g. in aerospace, transport, building and health care. They facilitate recycling, lowering the carbon footprint and energy demand as well as limiting the need for raw materials that are scarce in Europe.

children.description: A European society powered by digital solutions that put people first, open up new opportunities for businesses, and boost the development of trustworthy technology to foster an open and democratic society and a vibrant and sustainable economy.
keywords: ai for society and the economy
children.label: AI for society and the economy
children.long_description: A European society powered by digital solutions that put people first, open up new opportunities for businesses, and boost the development of trustworthy technology to foster an open and democratic society and a vibrant and sustainable economy. AI for society and the economy.
primaryKeywords: ai for society and the economy

children.description: Better use of scientific data takes into account the need to balance openness with the protection of scientific information, commercialisation and Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), privacy concerns, and security, as well as questions of data management and preservation. Open access to data, as a core principle of open science, is predicated on assumptions that scientific data can be reused by other researchers.
children.label: better use of scientific data
children.long_description: Better use of scientific data takes into account the need to balance openness with the protection of scientific information, commercialisation and Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), privacy concerns, and security, as well as questions of data management and preservation. Open access to data, as a core principle of open science, is predicated on assumptions that scientific data can be reused by other researchers.

children.description: The European Commission's initiatives aim to improve online security, trust and inclusion. Trust and security are at the core of the European Digital Strategy. A reliable system of electronic signatures that work across EU countries through trust services and eId is vital for safe electronic commerce and efficient delivery of online public services.
children.label: security and connectivity
children.long_description: The European Commission's initiatives aim to improve online security, trust and inclusion. Trust and security are at the core of the European Digital Strategy. A reliable system of electronic signatures that work across EU countries through trust services and eId is vital for safe electronic commerce and efficient delivery of online public services. Security and connectivity.

children.description: promoting the development of Trustworthy AI by prompting ethics by design in Horizon Europe research and innovation projects.
children.label: trustworthy AI
children.long_description: Promoting the development of Trustworthy AI by prompting ethics by design in Horizon Europe research and innovation projects. AI ethics.

children.description: Well-coordinated use of AI can bring about significant improvements to society. It can help us reach climate and sustainability goals and will bring high-impact innovations in healthcare, education, transport, industry and many other sectors.
children.label: Artificial Intelligence
children.long_description: Well-coordinated use of AI can bring about significant improvements to society. It can help us reach climate and sustainability goals and will bring high-impact innovations in healthcare, education, transport, industry and many other sectors. Artificial Intelligence.

children.description: In the ePrivacy domain, the main objective is the protection of the confidentiality and the security of communications, which is rooted in the fundamental right to the respect of private and family life (including communications), as enshrined in the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights.
children.label: digital privacy
children.long_description: In the ePrivacy domain, the main objective is the protection of the confidentiality and the security of communications, which is rooted in the fundamental right to the respect of private and family life (including communications), as enshrined in the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights. Digital privacy. E-privacy.

children.description: Europe's e-Inclusion policy ensures that no one is left behind and promotes the use of ICTs to overcome exclusion, and improve employment opportunities, quality of life, social participation and cohesion.
children.label: digital society
children.long_description: Europe's e-Inclusion policy ensures that no one is left behind and promotes the use of ICTs to overcome exclusion, and improve employment opportunities, quality of life, social participation and cohesion. Digital society.

children.description: The Commission is working with social networking sites, the internet industry, parents, and other groups to build a better internet for kids. The Safer Internet Programme funds projects which empower and protect children and young people online
children.label: safer internet for children
children.long_description: The Commission is working with social networking sites, the internet industry, parents, and other groups to build a better internet for kids. The Safer Internet Programme funds projects which empower and protect children and young people online. Safer internet for children.

children.description: Electronic identification (eID) and electronic Trust Services (eTS) are key enablers for secure cross-border electronic transactions and central building blocks of the Digital Single Market.
children.label: trust services and electronic ID
children.long_description: Electronic identification (eID) and electronic Trust Services (eTS) are key enablers for secure cross-border electronic transactions and central building blocks of the Digital Single Market. Trust services and electronic ID. E-ID.

children.description: Digital Security refers to various ways of protecting computer's internet account and files from intrusion by an outside user.
children.label: Cybersecurity
children.long_description: Digital Security refers to various ways of protecting computer's internet account and files from intrusion by an outside user. Cybersecurity.

children.description: Animal biotechnology is a branch of biotechnology in which molecular biology techniques are used to genetically engineer (i.e. modify the genome of) animals in order to improve their suitability for pharmaceutical, agricultural or industrial applications. Animal biotechnology has been used to produce genetically modified animals that synthesize therapeutic proteins, have improved growth rates or are resistant to disease.
children.label: animal biotechnology
children.long_description: Animal biotechnology is a branch of biotechnology in which molecular biology techniques are used to genetically engineer (i.e. modify the genome of) animals in order to improve their suitability for pharmaceutical, agricultural or industrial applications. Animal biotechnology has been used to produce genetically modified animals that synthesize therapeutic proteins, have improved growth rates or are resistant to disease.

children.description: Bioelectronics is a field of research in the convergence of biology and electronics.
children.label: bioelectronics
children.long_description: Bioelectronics is a field of research in the convergence of biology and electronics.

children.description: Bioinformatics is an interdisciplinary field that develops methods and software tools for understanding biological data, in particular when the data sets are large and complex.
children.label: bioinformatics
children.long_description: Bioinformatics is an interdisciplinary field that develops methods and software tools for understanding biological data, in particular when the data sets are large and complex.

children.description: Biomaterials are those materials — be it natural or synthetic, alive or lifeless, and usually made of multiple components — that interact with biological systems. Biomaterials are often used in medical applications to augment or replace a natural function.
children.label: biomaterials
children.long_description: Biomaterials are those materials — be it natural or synthetic, alive or lifeless, and usually made of multiple components — that interact with biological systems. Biomaterials are often used in medical applications to augment or replace a natural function.

children.description: Biomedicine (also referred to as Western medicine, mainstream medicine or conventional medicine) is a branch of medical science that applies biological and physiological principles to clinical practice.
children.label: biomedicine
children.long_description: Biomedicine (also referred to as Western medicine, mainstream medicine or conventional medicine) is a branch of medical science that applies biological and physiological principles to clinical practice.

children.description: Environmental biotechnology is the branch of biotechnology that addresses environmental problems, such as the removal of pollution, renewable energy generation or biomass production, by exploiting biological processes.
children.label: environmental biotechnology
children.long_description: Environmental biotechnology is the branch of biotechnology that addresses environmental problems, such as the removal of pollution, renewable energy generation or biomass production, by exploiting biological processes.

children.description: Nanobiotechnology is a discipline in which tools from nanotechnology are developed and applied to study biological phenomena. For example, nanoparticles can serve as probes, sensors or vehicles for biomolecule delivery in cellular systems.
children.label: nanobiotechnology
children.long_description: Nanobiotechnology is a discipline in which tools from nanotechnology are developed and applied to study biological phenomena. For example, nanoparticles can serve as probes, sensors or vehicles for biomolecule delivery in cellular systems.

children.description: Nanotoxicology is a branch of toxicology concerned with the study of the toxicity of nanomaterials, which can be divided into those derived from combustion processes (like diesel soot), manufacturing processes (such as spray drying or grinding) and naturally occurring processes (such as volcanic eruptions or atmospheric reactions).
children.label: nanotoxicology
children.long_description: Nanotoxicology is a branch of toxicology concerned with the study of the toxicity of nanomaterials, which can be divided into those derived from combustion processes (like diesel soot), manufacturing processes (such as spray drying or grinding) and naturally occurring processes (such as volcanic eruptions or atmospheric reactions).

children.description: Neuroscience is the scientific study of the nervous system. It combines physiology, anatomy, molecular biology, developmental biology, cytology, mathematical modeling, and psychology to understand the fundamental and emergent properties of neurons and neural circuits.
children.label: neuroscience
children.long_description: Neuroscience is the scientific study of the nervous system. It combines physiology, anatomy, molecular biology, developmental biology, cytology, mathematical modeling, and psychology to understand the fundamental and emergent properties of neurons and neural circuits.

children.description: Pharmaceutics is the discipline of pharmacy that deals with the process of turning a new chemical entity (NCE) or old drugs into a medication to be used safely and effectively by patients.  It is also called the science of dosage form design.  There are many chemicals with pharmacological properties, but need special measures to help them achieve therapeutically relevant amounts at their sites of action. Pharmaceutics helps relate the formulation of drugs to their delivery and disposition in the body.
children.label: pharmaceutics
children.long_description: Pharmaceutics is the discipline of pharmacy that deals with the process of turning a new chemical entity (NCE) or old drugs into a medication to be used safely and effectively by patients.  It is also called the science of dosage form design.  There are many chemicals with pharmacological properties, but need special measures to help them achieve therapeutically relevant amounts at their sites of action. Pharmaceutics helps relate the formulation of drugs to their delivery and disposition in the body.

children.description: The Life Science Technologies section covers various fields within the biomedical sector including biological data analytics, bioinformatics, advances in biomaterials and bioelectronics, biomedical engineering, as well as the neuroscience sector.
children.label: Life science technologies
children.long_description: The Life Science Technologies section covers various fields within the biomedical sector including biological data analytics, bioinformatics, advances in biomaterials and bioelectronics, biomedical engineering, as well as the neuroscience sector.

children.description: Applied optics is a branch of optics and photonics that specifically focuses on using light for practical purposes. Such uses include collecting light from the sun and converting it to electricity, processing metals with high-power lasers and developing optical equivalents of electronic circuits.
children.label: applied optics
children.long_description: Applied optics is a branch of optics and photonics that specifically focuses on using light for practical purposes. Such uses include collecting light from the sun and converting it to electricity, processing metals with high-power lasers and developing optical equivalents of electronic circuits.

children.description: Green photonics is the study and development of applied optical systems for generating clean, renewable energy. This includes solar cells and photovoltaic devices, creating energy-efficient optical sources for lighting and display applications and developing environmentally friendly materials for optoelectronic devices and components.
children.label: green photonics
children.long_description: Green photonics is the study and development of applied optical systems for generating clean, renewable energy. This includes solar cells and photovoltaic devices, creating energy-efficient optical sources for lighting and display applications and developing environmentally friendly materials for optoelectronic devices and components.

children.description: Lasers, LEDs and light sources are devices that create light. LEDs (light emitting diodes) convert an electrical current into light using spontaneous emission in optically active semiconductors. Lasers add a mechanism for optical feedback, such as mirrors, that stimulates further emission and generates a high-intensity beam of radiation.
children.label: lasers leds and light sources
children.long_description: Lasers, LEDs and light sources are devices that create light. LEDs (light emitting diodes) convert an electrical current into light using spontaneous emission in optically active semiconductors. Lasers add a mechanism for optical feedback, such as mirrors, that stimulates further emission and generates a high-intensity beam of radiation.

children.description: Nanoelectromechanical systems (NEMS) are a class of devices integrating electrical and mechanical functionality on the nanoscale. NEMS form the logical next miniaturization step from so-called microelectromechanical systems, or MEMS devices.
children.label: mems and nems
children.long_description: Nanoelectromechanical systems (NEMS) are a class of devices integrating electrical and mechanical functionality on the nanoscale. NEMS form the logical next miniaturization step from so-called microelectromechanical systems, or MEMS devices. Mems and nems.

children.description: Optical materials and structures are substances used to manipulate the flow of light. This can include reflecting, absorbing, focusing or splitting an optical beam. The efficiency of a specific material at each task is strongly wavelength dependent, thus a full understanding of the interaction between light and matter is vital.
children.label: optical materials and structures
children.long_description: Optical materials and structures are substances used to manipulate the flow of light. This can include reflecting, absorbing, focusing or splitting an optical beam. The efficiency of a specific material at each task is strongly wavelength dependent, thus a full understanding of the interaction between light and matter is vital.

children.description: Optical metrology is using light to set the standards that define units of measurement and for other high-precision research. Optical clocks, for example, have the potential to define the unit of time — the second — to a more precise degree than is possible in the atomic clocks used at present.
children.label: optical metrology
children.long_description: Optical metrology is using light to set the standards that define units of measurement and for other high-precision research. Optical clocks, for example, have the potential to define the unit of time — the second — to a more precise degree than is possible in the atomic clocks used at present.

children.description: Optical physics is the study of the fundamental properties of light and its interaction with matter. This includes classical optical phenomena such as reflection, refraction, diffraction and interference, and also studying the quantum mechanical properties of individual packets of lights known as photons.
children.label: optical physics
children.long_description: Optical physics is the study of the fundamental properties of light and its interaction with matter. This includes classical optical phenomena such as reflection, refraction, diffraction and interference, and also studying the quantum mechanical properties of individual packets of lights known as photons.

children.description: Optical techniques are methods that use light to probe or control matter. One prominent example is optical spectroscopy, which includes such methods as pump–probe spectroscopy, Raman spectroscopy and photoemission spectroscopy. Other examples of optical techniques are microscopy, interferometry, ellipsometry, optical tweezers, and imaging and sensing.
children.label: optical techniques
children.long_description: Optical techniques are methods that use light to probe or control matter. One prominent example is optical spectroscopy, which includes such methods as pump–probe spectroscopy, Raman spectroscopy and photoemission spectroscopy. Other examples of optical techniques are microscopy, interferometry, ellipsometry, optical tweezers, and imaging and sensing.

children.description: Photoacoustics is the study of vibrations induced in matter by light. Laser light causes localised heating when it is absorbed by a surface. This in turn makes the target area expand and sends a pressure wave through the rest of the material. This effect enables imaging of opaque systems, particularly biological samples.
children.label: photoacoustics
children.long_description: Photoacoustics is the study of vibrations induced in matter by light. Laser light causes localised heating when it is absorbed by a surface. This in turn makes the target area expand and sends a pressure wave through the rest of the material. This effect enables imaging of opaque systems, particularly biological samples.

children.description: Photonics-based communication systems are optical communication systems that focus on the implementation of photonic systems like high speed photonic networks. This also includes research on optical regenerators, which improve optical signal quality.
children.label: photonics based communication technologies
children.long_description: Photonics-based communication systems are optical communication systems that focus on the implementation of photonic systems like high speed photonic networks. This also includes research on optical regenerators, which improve optical signal quality. Photonics based communication technologies.

children.description: Power electronics is the application of solid-state electronics to the control and conversion of electric power.
children.label: power electronics
children.long_description: Power electronics is the application of solid-state electronics to the control and conversion of electric power.

children.description: A radio-frequency microelectromechanical system (RFMEMS) is a microelectromechanical systems with electronic components comprising moving sub-millimeter-sized parts that provide radio-frequency (RF) functionality. RF functionality can be implemented using a variety of RF technologies. Besides RF MEMS technology, III-V compound semiconductor (GaAs, GaN, InP, InSb), ferrite, ferroelectric, silicon-based semiconductor (RF CMOS, SiC and SiGe), and vacuum tube technology are available to the RF designer.
children.label: rf technologies
children.long_description: A radio-frequency microelectromechanical system (RFMEMS) is a microelectromechanical systems with electronic components comprising moving sub-millimeter-sized parts that provide radio-frequency (RF) functionality. RF functionality can be implemented using a variety of RF technologies. Besides RF MEMS technology, III-V compound semiconductor (GaAs, GaN, InP, InSb), ferrite, ferroelectric, silicon-based semiconductor (RF CMOS, SiC and SiGe), and vacuum tube technology are available to the RF designer.

children.description: Semiconductor materials technologies involves methods and tools for the preparation and evaluation of semiconductor materials, which are used in a host of modern electrical and electronic devices. Their functioning depends on the presence of small amounts of impurities such as phosphorus in the basic crystal element silicon.
children.label: semiconductor materials technologies
children.long_description: Semiconductor materials technologies involves methods and tools for the preparation and evaluation of semiconductor materials, which are used in a host of modern electrical and electronic devices. Their functioning depends on the presence of small amounts of impurities such as phosphorus in the basic crystal element silicon.

children.description: Micro- and Nanoelectronics deal with semiconductor components and/or highly miniaturized electronic subsystems and their integration in larger products and systems. They include the fabrication, the design, the packaging and test from nano-scale transistors to micro-scale systems integrating multiple functions on a chip. Optics and photonics is the study of the fundamental properties of light and harnessing them in practical applications. Optics and photonics covers the entire electromagnetic spectrum from high-energy gamma rays and X-rays, through the optical regime of ultraviolet, visible, and infrared light, to long-wavelength microwave and radio waves.
children.label: MNE and photonics
children.long_description: Micro- and Nanoelectronics deal with semiconductor components and/or highly miniaturized electronic subsystems and their integration in larger products and systems. They include the fabrication, the design, the packaging and test from nano-scale transistors to micro-scale systems integrating multiple functions on a chip. Optics and photonics is the study of the fundamental properties of light and harnessing them in practical applications. Optics and photonics covers the entire electromagnetic spectrum from high-energy gamma rays and X-rays, through the optical regime of ultraviolet, visible, and infrared light, to long-wavelength microwave and radio waves. MNE and photonics.

public scheme for energy efficient refurbishment

Water resources.

children.description: Prohibit certain forms of fisheries subsidies which contribute to overcapacity and overfishing, eliminate subsidies that contribute to illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and refrain from introducing new such subsidies, recognizing that appropriate and effective special and differential treatment for developing and least developed countries should be an integral part of the World Trade Organization fisheries subsidies negotiation.  effectively regulate harvesting and end overfishing, illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and destructive fishing practices and implement science-based management plans, in order to restore fish stocks in the shortest time feasible, at least to levels that can produce maximum sustainable yield as determined by their biological characteristics. Provide access for small-scale artisanal fishers to marine resources and markets
children.label: fishing
children.long_description: Prohibit certain forms of fisheries subsidies which contribute to overcapacity and overfishing, eliminate subsidies that contribute to illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and refrain from introducing new such subsidies, recognizing that appropriate and effective special and differential treatment for developing and least developed countries should be an integral part of the World Trade Organization fisheries subsidies negotiation.  effectively regulate harvesting and end overfishing, illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and destructive fishing practices and implement science-based management plans, in order to restore fish stocks in the shortest time feasible, at least to levels that can produce maximum sustainable yield as determined by their biological characteristics. Provide access for small-scale artisanal fishers to marine resources and markets.

children.description: Prevent and significantly reduce marine pollution of all kinds, in particular from land-based activities, including marine debris and nutrient pollution. Minimize and address the impacts of ocean acidification, including through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels.
children.label: marine pollution
children.long_description: Prevent and significantly reduce marine pollution of all kinds, in particular from land-based activities, including marine debris and nutrient pollution. Minimize and address the impacts of ocean acidification, including through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels.

children.description: Increase scientific knowledge, develop research capacity and transfer marine technology, taking into account the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission Criteria and Guidelines on the Transfer of Marine Technology, in order to improve ocean health and to enhance the contribution of marine biodiversity to the development of developing countries, in particular small island developing States and least developed countries
children.label: marine technology
children.long_description: Increase scientific knowledge, develop research capacity and transfer marine technology, taking into account the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission Criteria and Guidelines on the Transfer of Marine Technology, in order to improve ocean health and to enhance the contribution of marine biodiversity to the development of developing countries, in particular small island developing States and least developed countries.

children.description: Enhance the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources by implementing international law as reflected in the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, which provides the legal framework for the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources.  Sustainably manage and protect marine and coastal ecosystems to avoid significant adverse impacts, including by strengthening their resilience, and take action for their restoration in order to achieve healthy and productive oceans.  Conserve at least 10 per cent of coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information. increase the economic benefits to small island developing States and least developed countries from the sustainable use of marine resources, including through sustainable management of fisheries, aquaculture and tourism.
children.label: sustainable marine resources
children.long_description: Enhance the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources by implementing international law as reflected in the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, which provides the legal framework for the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources.  Sustainably manage and protect marine and coastal ecosystems to avoid significant adverse impacts, including by strengthening their resilience, and take action for their restoration in order to achieve healthy and productive oceans.  Conserve at least 10 per cent of coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information. increase the economic benefits to small island developing States and least developed countries from the sustainable use of marine resources, including through sustainable management of fisheries, aquaculture and tourism. Sustainable marine resources.

children.long_description: Combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods. Soil quality.

children.long_description: SDG 15 Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss. Life on land.

children.long_description: Build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters. Disaster vulnerability.

children.description: Significantly reduce the number of deaths and the number of people affected and substantially decrease the direct economic losses relative to global gross domestic product caused by disasters, including water-related disasters, with a focus on protecting the poor and people in vulnerable situations. Substantially increase the number of cities and human settlements adopting and implementing integrated policies and plans towards inclusion, resource efficiency, mitigation and adaptation to climate change, resilience to disasters, and develop and implement, in line with the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015–2030, holistic disaster risk management at all levels

children.long_description: Strengthen efforts to protect and safeguard the world’s cultural and natural heritage. Heritage conservation.

children.long_description: Provide access to safe, affordable, accessible and sustainable transport systems for all, improving road safety, notably by expanding public transport, with special attention to the needs of those in vulnerable situations, women, children, persons with disabilities and older persons. Transport infrastructure. Urban mobility.

children.description: Support positive economic, social and environmental links between urban, peri-urban and rural areas by strengthening national and regional development planning. Provide universal access to safe, inclusive and accessible, green and public spaces, in particular for women and children, older persons and persons with disabilities.  Enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and capacity for participatory, integrated and sustainable human settlement planning and management in all countries. Support least developed countries, including through financial and technical assistance, in building sustainable and resilient buildings utilizing local materials.
children.label: urban planning and governance
children.long_description: Support positive economic, social and environmental links between urban, peri-urban and rural areas by strengthening national and regional development planning. Provide universal access to safe, inclusive and accessible, green and public spaces, in particular for women and children, older persons and persons with disabilities.  Enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and capacity for participatory, integrated and sustainable human settlement planning and management in all countries. Support least developed countries, including through financial and technical assistance, in building sustainable and resilient buildings utilizing local materials. Urban planning and governance.

children.label: Sustainable cities and communities
children.long_description: SDG 11 Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable. Sustainable cities and communities.

children.description: enhance agricultural productive capacity in developing countries; correct and prevent trade restrictions and distortions in world agricultural markets; elimination of agricultural export subsidies; ensure the proper functioning of food commodity markets and their derivatives; facilitate timely access to market information, including on food reserves; limit extreme food price volatility

Agricultural productivity and markets.

children.description: strengthen capacity of food production for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality; maintain the genetic diversity of seeds, cultivated plants and farmed and domesticated animals and their related wild species, including through soundly managed and diversified seed and plant banks; prevent food wastage
children.label: food security
children.long_description: Strengthen capacity of food production for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality; maintain the genetic diversity of seeds, cultivated plants and farmed and domesticated animals and their related wild species, including through soundly managed and diversified seed and plant banks; prevent food wastage. Food security.

children.description: ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food; end all forms of malnutrition, including stunting and wasting in children; address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women and older persons

children.long_description: SDG 2 End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture. Zero hunger.
